Work Place based median earnings (Gross Weekly), by Full time and Gender
Gross weekly earnings per head: by place of work (ASHE). And annual median and mean earnings, both in nominal and real terms, and lower quartile earnings.
Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings (ASHE), ONS and ONS CPI series
Survey data from a sample frame, use caution if using for performance measurement and trend analysis
# These figures are suppressed as statistically unreliable.
! Estimate and confidence interval not available since the group sample size is zero or disclosive (0-2).
Results for 2003 and earlier exclude supplementary surveys. In 2006 there were a number of methodological changes made. For further details goto : http://www.nomisweb.co.uk/articles/341.aspx.
Standard error as a percentage of the figure

Note: '% conf' These measures are termed coefficients of variation (CVs). The CV is the ratio of the standard error of an estimate to the estimate itself and is expressed as a percentage. The true value is likely to lie within +/- twice the CV.
Figures are median unless otherwise specified.
Real earnings figures are on sheets labelled "real", are in 2016 prices, and calculated by applying ONSâ€™s annual CPI index series for April to ASHE data
